1123 “Clinton Corruption Files” – Bondi, Patel Give Congress New Evidence Detailing Clinton Foundation Corruption (www.thegatewaypundit.com) posted 24 hours ago by PiratePatriotParrot 89 comments award share report block "Clinton Corruption Files" - Bondi, Patel Give Congress New Evidence Detailing Clinton Foundation Corruption | The Gateway Pundi... US Attorney General Pam Bondi and FBI Director Kash Patel have provided Congress with new evidence detailing Clinton Foundation corruption. www.thegatewaypundit.com

The article labels them "whistleblowers", which is technically not the case, they are attorneys who conduct financial audits/analysis of charity organizations for fraud and violations. They do this for profit, basically bounty hunters for the IRS.  In this case they sent their findings to the FBI and the IRS, and if the foundation is prosecuted these guys stand to make 10's of millions in reward money as a % of the damages claimed by the IRS. With that much reward cash on the line my guess is that these guys have been hammering Trump's DOJ to reopen this thing. permalink award report block reply TEXinLA 3 points 22 hours ago No Statute of Limitations for the IRS. No wonder we're fucked. permalink award report block reply mass55th 1 points 20 hours ago They should have been investigated while they were still in the White House taking money from the Chi-coms. Their asian bundlers got charged and went to prison, but somehow the Clintons weren't held responsible for taking foreign cash. Terry McAuliffe was involved in that as well, but he walked, then ran for Governor of Virginia, and got elected. In 2016, while he was still Governor, he was being investigated by the Feds for accepting illegal contributions. In 2018, he was involved in a lawsuit brought by 32 Chinese investors in McAuliffe's start-up Greentech Automotive Inc. that went bust. He was CEO of the company. The investments were made under a federal program that let foreign nationals receive U.S. residency visas if they invest in companies that create U.S. jobs. The 32 investors each put up $500,000. The company received millions in subsidies to build a factory in Mississippi, but the company never got off the ground and went bankrupt. The plaintiffs filed suit, saying Greentech’s failure threatens their ability to remain in the U.S. The old bait and switch routine. I take your money under false pretenses, and then you get it stuck up your ass. In 2017, Virginia state’s auditor demanded the firm repay $6.4 million in public funds. I see no record of that money ever being paid back. What's even worse, Judge Claude Hilton, a Reagan appointee hearing the lawsuit brought forth by the Chinese investors dismissed McAuliffe from the suit, along with his buddy Anthony Rodham...Hillary Clinton's brother. He was alleged to have played a role in recruiting investors and misrepresenting Greentech’s viability. Two big scam artists.
